activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry S. Mess Jr.

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM Defendant Larry S. Mess Jr. in court. Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Larry S. Mess Jr. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. St. Piere would like to set case for a plea and sentencing. Schiek has complied with victim rights. Bond continued. adj. 03:13 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Larry S. Mess Jr. appearing telephonically. Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Larry S. Mess Jr. Victim appearing in court. Defendant states tested positive for COVID. Sowinski states there was offer - will be sure offer is send to new counsel. Saint Pierre wanting on discovery - has offer. Bond bond continued. adj. 03:11 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea.
Bail continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant has contacted PD's office - is eligible - waiting for appointment. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court - states attorney not appointed yet. Bond continued. adj. 03:01 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Larry S. Mess Jr. appeared in court. Defendant states he is going to obtain private counsel. Bond continued. adj. 02:56 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No contact with business or owner

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Larry S. Mess Jr. appeared in court. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj.
